column4: has anyone attempted to connect a realvnc enterprise viewer to vino (as in windows computer with the viewer, ubuntu with the server)? i'm getting a "no matching security types" error viewer-side.
try rdesktop?
i'm not sure if i'm using rdesktop or not, honestly. i attempted to set up remote viewing via system->preferences->remote desktop. i was under the impression that that was vino.
when I remote I use rdesktop it handles RDP well.
RDP? i don't know what that is, i'm sorry.
you are trying to remote against a windows host or?
ubuntu is the server, windows is the client
right
and you get an auth error?
also, seriously, #ubuntu is under attack by script kiddies? feels awful 1998 in here :)
perhaps i should try a different server ubuntu-side?
tightVNC server and thightvnc client is a protip :D
any idea if tightvnc server will be ok with realvnc viewer?
what type of server do you use?
nah sorry :/
like i said, i honestly don't even know what the VNC server is. it is whatever i access by going through system - preferences - remote desktop
i thought it was vino, but i could easily be wrong.
ahh, now I see, perhaps you need to try and use a standalone VNC server because I do not know what type this is :S
fair enough. in fact, i think i recall using tightvnc for this very purpose a long time ago.
yeah, I think that would be simpler. Got the feeling that the ubuntu way is for between ubuntu machines only
or realvnc is just a PITA :) thanks though, i'm off.
np have fun
